Review_Text: Went and toured this place with 2 of my friends today. Was always throughly pleased and impressed with The Waters when I visited some friends who lived here last year. Rebecca Elliot was extremely kind and very knowledgeable when welcoming us in, presenting leasing options, and giving us a tour of the place. Very excited to be moving in here 2 months from now. Very clean, still has that brand new feel, and a very fresh and welcoming community space. This definitely will be the nicest rental property I‚Äôve ever stayed at. Without a doubt the best apartment space to rent in Hammond, LA.
Beautiful Resort style location staff is 5 star maintenance are always on time. Pool and game room is very enjoyable nice clean always available for use. Love the ability to get Starbucks.

I went on a apartment tour for The Waters at Hammond and had the honor of the exceptional Ms. Kamryn as my tour guide. I had a wonderful experience on my tour and Ms. Kamryn was very helpful in answering all of my questions.

My friend and I were in the search of apartments in the Hammond, Louisiana area and fell in love with the positive and peaceful environment of The Waters at Hammond apartment complex. I am writing this review today because I would like to give a personal shoutout to Ms. Kamryn because she helped us choose The Waters as our new home.

Throughout our time researching the Waters, Ms. Kamryn has always made herself available for questions and concerns. She knew we were new to the apartment searching process and helped us feel more comfortable and at ease. Overall, Ms. Kamryn has done an amazing job helping us and I thank her for her excellent customer service.
Great views and the BEST amenities. Staff is always so helpful and very knowledgeable. love living at this complex.

I have lived here at the waters for two years. The staff go above and beyond. The property is always clean and welcoming. My girls love going for walks around the pond and to the park. The neighbors are wonderful. Sitting on the patio, the passing neighbors always speak. I love that it‚Äôs pet friendly. I hate pets inside my apartment but my kids love being on the patio or walking and see others walking their dogs. Chris, Erika, and Charlie feel like extended family. (They are who you meet in the office) Maintenance guys are great ! Any problem big or small they are on the way asap to find and fix the issue.

DO NOT MOVE HERE!!!

Please don‚Äôt move here! They will mess your credit history up! They don‚Äôt answer the phone and if  they need to contact you Regarding your apartment for any financial reasons they will just send everything to the collection agency! Now I‚Äôm dealing with an eviction on my credit after I paid the buy out of the lease. I was never contacted until months later and even then they charged me with the wrong amounts of things that were over charged! I will be getting my lawyer involved because this is unacceptable.

PLEASE DO NOT RENT FROM HERE!

I would highly recommend The Waters at Hammond.  Beautiful property and great staff, from the office to the maintenance crew.  I do visit friends who live there and have enjoyed the pool and gym area many times last year.  The courtesy/police officer on site seems to be on top of her job (from what I have seen and heard).
About the courtesy/police officer (since I‚Äôve seen some bad reviews about her)‚Ä¶
I have witnessed her or her along with staff doing pool checks to make sure people are following the rules/policies of the property.  Two people per apartment seems to be a little strict but at the same time I understand there are over 300 apartments there.  It is good to know there are not a lot of outside people taking up all the space in the amenity areas (like some places may have).  I have spoken to her, and she seems to be as fair as a person can be.  Her motto: ‚ÄúRead your lease, follow the rules and respect your neighbors‚Äù.  What more could you ask for?  My friends say that she enforces the rules no matter what your race is and as fair as possible.  So, on the negative comments, I ask myself... Were they following the rules/policies?
About the negative comments, how many people read their lease COMPLETELY?  If they read what they were signing, then they would know the rules/policies of what they can and cannot do.

Very rude courtesy officer. We made a simple mistake of misreading a sign and being in the pool 18 minutes after it closed and the ‚Äúcourtesy officer‚Äù barged in through the gate in a robe with no identification yelling at us demanding our unit number and personal information. After explaining it was a human mistake of misreading a sign from not using the pool often she continued yelling and demanding personal information and wasn‚Äôt providing any credentials and made us feel very unsafe. She is a very angry individual and regardless of us trying to repeatedly explain it being a human mistake and saying we were leaving immediately she kept yelling and said we ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt know how to read‚Äù.  it made us feel very unsafe even walking back because we didn‚Äôt know if she was following. Verbally insulting tenants for a 18 minute mistake and harassment isn‚Äôt necessary. Will not be using this amenity again.

Connie is the absolute best! Not only does she keep the property clean and beautiful, she has quickly become the best part of my morning walk with my dog, Maverick! Connie and the staff here at the Flats make an intentional effort to be true friends to the tenants & their pets! üíõ

I love living at the Flats of East Bay. I particularly love the staff! Jima is on staff and she is always busy working, keeping up with the clubhouse, taking care of residents needs and she couldn't be more professional and kind! She is truly an asset to your team!
Beautiful complex, kept clean by the best crew around, Jima & Connie! Alyson and Chelsea in leasing make you feel at home with their kindness and understanding.
Caring staff. Connie and Jima keep everything so beautiful and maintenance is always quick to fix things. Recommend living here to everyone, you cannot beat these amenities.

The Staff was very accommodating when I changed my move-in date and was helpful in finding the right apartment in the complex that would be best suited for me.  Been here a couple of months and enjoying my new home.

The best place to live with best people. Kind, caring staff who go out of their way to make it a wonderful place to live. Blane is so knowledgeable and friendly, and just makes the front office such a warm, welcoming place to be. Chelsea personally helped me get through the application and move in process, and does so much to make the Flats community beautiful and welcoming. Allyson is a treasure and cares deeply about the residents and their experience here. Chase-in maintenance- is so kind and helpful. Any slight maintenance issue has always been handled in such a timely and efficient manner. I cant say enough about how much I love living here, because the people who work here seem to care so much about the residents feelng at home. It's affordable, pristine, safe and cozy. I'm truly grateful everyday to have landed here.

The move in process was super easy thanks to all the help from Blaine and Chelsea! They communicated exactly what paperwork I needed on move in day. On move in day I had all my paperwork and Chelsea set everything up for me and put all the apps on my phone I needed and set them up so I didn‚Äôt have to. Chelsea did everything for me and I had keys to my new place in less than 15 minutes! The staff is amazing and keep this place clean and looking brand new. The residents are super friendly and everyone is so nice. So glad I picked the flats at east bay!

From the beginning Chelsea stayed in contact answering any questions I had making sure this was an easy move. The property is beautiful & everyone has been extremely helpful & kind. Special thanks to Mrs. Lorese for moving a good bit of my furniture in my apartment before my arrival which was no easy task & for being the absolute sweetest. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to call home.

Still under construction but we‚Äôre almost done and will be open soon, amenities areas are so cool and the rooms are nice as well normal apartment spaces, don‚Äôt know anything about the pricing but it looks pretty.
Has everything you could want. Don't look anywhere else.

Resort-style living in the heart of the city? Yes, please!
We‚Äôre loving it here, not just for the vacation vibes, but for so many thoughtful details:
‚úÖ Approachable, genuinely friendly, and responsive management (special mention to Allison, Maggie, Jacob, Sharon, Michael from Maintenance)
‚úÖ Welcoming neighbors (even the pups are social!)
‚úÖ Gated and well-lit (safe for late-night dog walks
‚úÖ Pool, clubhouse, mailroom & fitness room: all phone-accessed!
‚úÖ Fenced-in dog park = happy pup life
‚úÖ Gorgeous clubhouse (we‚Äôve already enjoyed one fun event and can‚Äôt wait for more)
‚úÖ Our balcony is our cozy retreat
‚úÖ Scenic ponds + aesthetic views = daily ‚Äúahhh‚Äù moments
‚úÖ Free snacks and Starbucks coffee at the Clubhouse (my 11-year-old saw that on our tour and said, ‚ÄúDeal‚Äôs closed. We‚Äôre living here!‚Äù üòÇ)
‚úÖ Costco across the road + fave restaurants nearby
‚úÖ Valet trash pickup = added convenience
‚úÖ And we got to break in brand-new appliances üôå
City living, comfort, and community. üëåüèº So glad to call this place home! ‚ù§Ô∏è

A NEW apartment complex in the community.  I took a tour of the facility and was a little impressed of the amenities more than the space in the apartment. Love the pool area.

Telling it like it IS üòÄ
TerryB ü¶º
Allison was amazing today. She definitely  knew her stuff. Can't wait to make this  place  home... Maggie was also very professional and  friendly.  What a great staff!!!

The front office manager, Jacob he‚Äôs a very nice respectful, young guy and Aaliyah, they are all very respectful. They are so sweet and nice to everyone that comes into the office. The whole office crew is very polite and very manageable and respectful. I speak highly of them. They try their best to help you with any situation that occur on the property and everything with you . I Can say this about the apartment complex it‚Äôs a lovely place to live and the maintenance people be right on time they comes out and fix the problem that you‚Äôve they responded quickly and they‚Äôre very helpful polite
We toured the place and loved it! We applied for a place right after the tour! Highly recommend!
Great complex and staff.
Amazing place amazing people 10 stars
Perfect location and has friendly staff!!

Jordan and Reagan were incredible throughout the entire leasing process. From the very beginning, they were friendly, professional, and always available to answer my questions. They made what can sometimes be a stressful experience feel completely effortless. I truly felt supported every step of the way, and they went above and beyond to make sure everything was handled smoothly.

Thanks to them, as a fellow stoa team member, I felt confident and excited about my decision‚Äîand I‚Äôm so happy to now call this place my new home. I can‚Äôt wait to get settled in! Huge thanks to Jordan and Reagan for making it such a positive experience!

One of the nicest apartment complexes we have toured. The amenities are spacious and first class. The pool area is really nice. The grills are a very nice touch. The apartments are very nice. We love the layout and the appliances are very nice. The welcome gift was a very nice surprise!
Everyone has been really professional and very helpful. Hopefully the team never changes. Joyce you rock üòä. Thank you everyone for all your help!

I love living here. I've only been here since Feb but so far my experience has been great. An'Tajha made my move in seamless. She was so courteous and knowledgeable about the apartments and answered all my questions. She stayed with a smile on her face and was a pleasure to talk to.

I started off loving this apartment because they are very nice and maintenance does a great job keeping it clean but when it comes to the office staff when I moved in, I was handed a map and was told to find my apartment so I had to drive around and look for it. They tried to reschedule my move-in time after I paid the movers to be here for a certain time, but we got over that.  A few months later this car came speeding through the parking lot and hit my car head on, and yet they put a sticker on my car in the parking lot in the spot that I pay for telling me that it will be towed because it doesn‚Äôt meet the physical requirements and the car was still driveable. A few months later, I was informed by the courtesy officer that they told him To put the ticket on my car because they rented out the spot that I currently pay for to a new resident without telling me, and without my permission and are still forcing me to move out of the spot for them when it was their mistake. I received no apology!

Maintenance is quick and productive, but I‚Äôm really tired and aggravated with this valet trash. They charge an extra $35 per month, and sometimes the trashman doesn‚Äôt even come. It‚Äôs even worse when they don‚Äôt pick up the trash; they leave the lid open, allowing gnats and other insects to swarm over it. This is a recurring issue. The trash men they hire is always lazy

The Waters apartments is a nice place to stay. I really love it here. The only problem is, to me we starting to get a few bad apples. But the management at this apartment is good. There's this one guy I would like to recognize as VIP of this complex. He is truly the best. Luke thanks for all you do to make our home and community look so dam good. Your positive attitude really means a lot. I most definitely would recommend this place to live.

If you are considering moving here and want a safe, quiet, and friendly environment, look elsewhere. Just to name a few safety issues, tons of the residents here speed through the parking lot going at least 25-30mph nearly causing accidents every day almost running into other cars and even people just walking around. You will be tailgated by other residents if you‚Äôre cruising around the parking lot too slowly. Tons of pet owners will not leash their dogs and will not pick up after them. Their pet waste can be found all over the grass for you or another resident/guest to step in.

The apartment units themselves may look nice on the inside but they seem to be built with cardboards purchased from Temu as there is barely any sound insulation. If you have a neighbor living above you, you will hear EVERYTHING. If someone is having a conversation outside your window, you will feel like you are a part of it and can hear every detail. At night, there is a quiet hours policy but that doesn‚Äôt mean anything. You can call the after hours number to complain but that will not do anything other than sending someone out to tell someone else that they‚Äôre noisy.

My only positive about this place is that their maintenance team is to respond and fix things. Other than that, I would not live here again.

Issues are addressed promptly and I appreciate that, that‚Äôs the most important factor for me when renting. The staff is also very nice and host community events often so it feels like home. I must say, i wasn‚Äôt too pleased when I first moved in but I gave them some time and I‚Äôm glad I did.

I wish I could give 10 stars. The staff was very kind, knowledgeable, answered all questions, and provided a great tour of the property. The ambiance of the property is beyond exceptional and I love the apartment layout. The maintenance team is very professional, prompt, and kind. I feel very safe living here and am looking forward to meeting my neighbors.

I love this property! The management team here is absolutely phenomenal, and the amenities here make it feel like a vacation everyday. I recommend The Waters to anyone that is looking for an upgrade! Schmidt is the one that helped me out, and she was incredibly knowledgeable and really took the time to help me narrow down my perfect home!

I spoke with a lady named Veronica. She was extremely helpful. I‚Äôm looking at moving across the country to live in Florida again and this is the area I settled on. She was very insightful and was willing to explain above and beyond just the housing at these apartments but the surrounding area as well giving me insight into what is nearby for shopping and entertainment and included information that would help my dog adjust to the area as well

Everyone is so friendly.  Including the residents and the leasing office ladies, Kimberly, Tiffani and Veronica helped our move in be seamless. Hunter and the rest of the maintenance team are amazing. They even installed new fire alarms with lights for my fianc√© who is deaf. Tiffani made sure before we moved to have all the important paperwork for the accommodation to be filled out. Amazing people!
I just moved here two days ago. I chose this place because I truly love it. At the moment, I have nothing negative to say.

First off, rent here is ridiculously high. A one bed room half the size of a New York studio shouldn‚Äôt cost nobody 1200+. A one bed room at minimum if you‚Äôre going to make it pricey should be at least 1,000-1,100. Also, the carports being $60 dollars a month is DIABOLICALLY RIDICULOUSüò≠üòÇ on top of your rent?! C‚Äômon now. I want to also point out, be on top of your P&Q‚Äôs if you‚Äôre going to let 3rd party companies work on the complex/ community. Also, no refunds is nasty work(especially if you guys mess up on your end.. unintentionally though) I understand things do happen. Also, the stair cases stained with dog piss and the community filled with dog doodoo is bafflingüíÄ. Please have somebody pressure wash the place or something. You guys preach how you want the community to look clean, but yet it‚Äôs not‚Ä¶ at all. Plus the whole smart lock thing, why charge more on people‚Äôs rent for that? We already paying thousands dollars a year. That should be free lmao. Like what? I‚Äôm just trying to give tips that‚Äôs all. Other than that, I love the fact that there are community events!!!! Veronica is the the most sweetest person I know!!! That‚Äôs my little bestie üòÇü´∂üèæ  I also would recommend a basketball court! That would be so TUFF!!!!! The pool great addition bc it‚Äôs hot. People here are friendly & I love the maintenance team.

My wife and I moved in about a month ago and it has been nothing but one positive after another. We love the amenities and location of the apartments. In 1 day, we can go to the store, the pharmacy and out to eat and only travel a total of 2 miles. Our beagle loves the area and feels right at home

I love this place thanks to the exceptional efforts of all the staff here, especially Veronica, Ava, Tiffani, and Don. From the moment I moved in, Veronica and Ava have been a beacon of professionalism and kindness, always ensuring that any concerns are addressed promptly and efficiently. Don‚Äôs attention to detail and commitment to maintaining the property in pristine condition has made living here an absolute pleasure. Tiffani's warm and welcoming demeanor has created a sense of community that truly makes this place feel like home.

The fun community events organized by the team are the cherry on top. There is always something exciting happening to bring residents together. These events not only provide entertainment but also foster a strong sense of community among neighbors.

Together, these outstanding individuals and the vibrant community events have transformed the complex into a haven of comfort and enjoyment. Highly recommended!

The Waters at Redstone has a resort-like feel and the hospitality they show is one of a kind. I will always be recommending these apartments to those looking for an affordable place to call home. The amazing amenities they have are nothing like I‚Äôve seen before. The leasing consultants are so very sweet and down to earth. The maintenance men are all always willing to lend a helping hand.
If you or anyone you know is looking for a place to call home, give The Waters at Redstone a call.

The Waters at Redstone has been an excellent living experience for both me and my cat Arlo.

I moved into the Waters a few months ago as one of their first tenants and they have been nothing but hospitable and excellent the entire time. Regularly they will host small parties with excellent food and drink that offer great opportunities to meet new people and mingle with your neighbors.

The maintenance staff is very helpful and even helped me when I was in a jam moving furniture (Big shoutout to Ronald). The rest of the staff is awesome as well!

Ava helped me immensely in my leadup to moving in often answering questions over email in a few minutes and always happy to provide me with information at a moments notice, this was great for me as a first apartment experience.

Veronica has helped me several times with questions in regards to billing and even helped me get set up with my mobile device applications very quickly.

Tiffany is an excellent community manager. Her and the rest of her team exude hospitality and I have never felt like a nuisance with even the most trivial of questions. Tiffany even offered to help me resolve some issues with FPL on a moments notice.

The staff at Redstone is fantastic, always asking me how I am doing and being genuinely invested in their tenants. I would strongly recommend this apartment to anyone interested.

The amenities are also excellent with a fully stocked gym, pool, and self service Starbucks coffee machine. This place is very luxurious at  a very reasonable price.

Only been here two days, but this place is great. For one, obviously, because it's all new, but the layout of the apartment we are in is awesome. It's all up-to-date, modern design and right next to grocery stores and many other stores. The price is about what you'd expect for an apartment in Lafayette, especially in a nice area. Management is very helpful to us, which you won't find at many apartment complexes, I hope it stays this way. There is the issue of residents leaving trash outside of the compactor which is rude, especially considering these are brand new. I have yet to live in an apartment as great as this one is.

I am going to be really honest. I have been living here since the end of March. With the recent transfer of The Waters from being managed by Stoa Group to now Greystar, I am highly concerned the quality is going to go down. Right now, I do not think I will renew my lease because of all the management changes and not to mention how many times their fire alarm company needs to be on property. They needed to do work all day on June 9th and now they need to do more work on July 10th? It's the biggest hassle to be disturbed when you are paying a premium price (1500+) for an apartment. I guess we will see how this goes, but I don't think the quality is going to get any better. If anything, worse. It's like any apartment management company really, they just care about your money.

We were looking for apartments for my sister in law and called the office for some information but huge mistake!! Receptionist were very sharp on answering and we set an appointment for today at 1 but she just hang out without even asking for our names. So we deleted this place on our apartment complex list üò°üò°üò°

Living at the Waters at Settlers Trace has been an incredible experience! The apartments are modern, spacious, and filled with thoughtful touches like the stainless steel appliances and large windows with natural light. The community amenities are exceptional: a sparkling pool, fully equipped gym, and peaceful, spacious lounge areas.

The management team is friendly, professional, and quick to respond to any concerns, which makes living here stress-free. My Wife, Victoria, loves working for the STOA group. Maintenance is always efficient and resolves issues promptly.

The location is ideal, with easy access to restaurants, Target, and just making life even more convenient. The neighborhood feels safe, clean, and welcoming, with friendly neighbors and plenty of green spaces to enjoy.

I highly recommend the Waters at Settlers Trace to anyone looking for a comfortable, stylish, and hassle-free place to live! It truly feels like a home of your own.

Avoid moving into any of the buildings behind the Whole Foods shopping center. Every night around 2 a.m., the garbage collectors come through and it‚Äôs extremely loud. I‚Äôve reported it, but they said there‚Äôs nothing they can do. My baby and I get woken up every single night because of it. Other than that, I really love my apartment it‚Äôs just the nightly noise:(
Relaxed environment, staff is great and really go above and beyond to keep this place up. Really enjoy living here, amenities are top notch n

Me and my husband just got our welcome home letter today and we can't wait to move in soon. Everyone has been so friendly, helpful, and very welcoming! The property itself is beautiful and we can't wait to make it our home.

Our first tour was awesome, Grant was super informative and answered all questions we had. The amenities and atmosphere made this place feel like a community we wanted to live in! At the end of the tour Grant gave us all the information we needed to move forward and even told us where to set up electricity and cable which was super helpful coming from out of state.  So far we have settled in nicely and cant wait to go to community events in the future! 10/10!

My experience at The Waters at West Village began on a positive note, but it quickly turned into a nightmare. I moved into a brand-new apartment that had never been occupied before. However, within just two months, the vinyl tile floors started coming up. At first, it wasn‚Äôt too serious, but by October, I submitted a maintenance request. The team attempted to fix the issue by gluing the floors down, but it only worsened, especially in my bedroom.
As the flooring continued to lift, creating a serious tripping hazard, I submitted another maintenance request and invited the leasing manager to see the problem in person. She declined my invitation, citing the need to sort Christmas decorations. This dismissal made me feel neglected and unimportant. Instead, she promised to come by the following Monday, which coincided with Thanksgiving week. I explained that I had family coming over and was concerned about the safety risk. When she finally arrived, she acknowledged the problem, saying it would only take a day to fix. She also asked if I wanted  to switch to a different unit. However, since it was during holiday season and my apartment was fully furnished and decorated, I preferred to stay, provided the floors could be repaired.
Despite explaining the urgency of the situation to her supervisor, I was left waiting for months with no resolution. What followed was a series of unprofessional delays, poor communication, and a complete lack of accountability. Though promises were made that the issue would be handled quickly, the floors weren‚Äôt repaired for over four months. Both the leasing manager and the property management team failed to follow up or provide any clarity when I repeatedly asked about the next steps as the floors were getting worse. I even inquired about moving to a different unit, specifically one facing the pond, but was told there were none available. They assured me that the repairs would be quick, but there was no clear plan in place.
In January 2025, I was finally informed that moisture tests would be conducted in my apartment on January 14th and that the replacement floors were on back order. After the tests were completed, they wanted to swiftly schedule the floor repairs, but once again, no concrete plan was provided when I asked how would the moving in and out  of my items would go and who would be financially responsible for packing materials. I was told that the property management team had never handled repairs in an occupied unit before and was unsure how to proceed. After months of living with hazardous floors, I sought legal help to address my concerns. By this point, I had developed an upper respiratory infection and had been to the ER, where I was diagnosed after weeks of persistent coughing and mucus.
Despite enduring months of living with unsafe floors, I was only offered partial rent credits for the time I couldn‚Äôt live comfortably in my apartment. I was also lied to about the moisture test, and the company ignored my lawyer‚Äôs requests for information. Once the floors were finally repaired, I asked for the underlying issues to be addressed to ensure my peace of mind, but my concerns were once again ignored.
What is most disappointing is how little the management team seemed to care about my actual living experience. They were more focused on hosting resident events and posting about them on social media than on maintaining a safe, comfortable, and respectful living environment. Though my floors were eventually repaired, the fundamental issues, as seen in the photos, were never properly tested or addressed, leaving me feeling unsafe in my own home.

**UPDATE**
SEE THIER YELP PAGE FOR MY COMPLETE REPONSE
The total disregard for my safety and the dismissal of my concerns after the tile was removed proves you could care less about a more positive living experience for my family and I. The new floors were swiftly put down without testing those spots for potential health hazards and that is extremely concerning.

Went yesterday to take a tour and was greeted by Kristin! She was so sweet and kind. Sara gave me a tour and she went through the unit and showed me everything. She was able to answer all of my questions pertaining to the apartment as well as give me multiple quotes for different lease lengths. Love the vibe of the property and that it has so many amazing amenities! Excited to move here in June! Thanks ladies ‚ù§Ô∏è
The process from start to finish was fairly easy. When minor bumps happened the staff was there to help me all of the way. I cannot say enough about them this far! Sara is the best!
I recently just moved to my 1bed room apartment and I love it here, everything is close and the scenery is amazing couldn‚Äôt be happier any where else.
Staff has been very accommodating and answers all questions quickly and professionally. Thoroughly explained any concerns that we had on moving day and previously asked.
Great amenities and amazing staff.
Top notch service and living.
